intro: Seringia botak, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and covered in fine hairs. Seringia botak is often found in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight.
